title: --files-from reads lots of local files - don't recurse into excluded directories
body:
Hello,
  I'm using rclone v1.28 on Debian Jessie 64-bits.
I'm trying to rclone copy using --files-from, something like:

rclone copy -v --config credsfile --files-from=listfiles ./ credname:/test2/

This is to Google Drive.

rclone procedes to build a (in my case) huge list of files found locally which are "Excluded from sync (and deletion)" .

My expectation would be that rclone simply copies the files listed in the files-from without any other hanky panky.

Thanks for a neat-o and fast tool!

.
